origin (x), (y), (z): Set where the first command block will be
set (variableName) (to|=|+=|-=|*=|/=|%=|: Create a new variable, use "to" to set it to a number, and any arithmetic such as =,+=,-=..., use another variable. So if you wanted to add 1, you'd have to declare another variable as such, set one to 1, set (variableName) += one
next: Start with a new row of commands
function (functionName): Starts a new row of commands, but can be called at any time by saying "exampleName()" or "exampleName(conditional)"
run: The command "run" executes the current row of command blocks. It wont create a new command block to run the row, but rather it will run it from the chat
variablesFor (variable host name): Sets what key holds the variables, by default, variablesFor is set to "c". You can access variablesFor at any time by typing {variablesFor}
goback: "goback" goes to the previous row of commands, but will start at the first command block.
[conditional]: The next command below this that creates a command block will be conditional
[alwaysactive]: The next command below this that creates a command block will be set to always active
armorstand (create (tag) (x) (y) (z)|rem: Armorstands can be used to track positions with /fill, /clone, /setblock,...
say (text|{minecraftVariableName}): You can use minecraft score variables along with text by doing {variableName}. Ex: say Current X Position: {xPos}
' (text): Acts as a header for the next command block. Will create a sign above the command block with the text.
space: offsets a command block and leaves a space.
timer (duration) (ticks|seconds|minutes|: creates a timer to run the command block after it
clearLine: clears the way for the row of command blocks so incase there are other command blocks from previous/old rows
clearLine (amount): clears the amount of blocks for the row
else: runs any conditional commands below it if the if statement's condition above it is false.
isHolding (item) (nameOfEventListener) (: creates an event listener to detect the currentPlayer's hand.
currentPlayer (playerName|@a|@p|@s|@r|@e: Sets the current player for any event listener commands or etc... By default is @a.
waitFor (block|score) ([blockType (x) (y: Waits for a block to be placed at the coordinates or a score to be a value
exampleFunction(): Parameters are allowed and the parameters are variables set to a value. As such: exampleFunction(varName=intOrOtherVarName)
runNextRow: Runs a future row that hasn't been added yet. sets a redstone block offset +2 on the z axis.
layerup: Adds a +2 offset to the y axis
layerdown: Subtracts a +2 offset to the y axis
